forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly sunny. High near 60, with temperatures falling to around 57 in the afternoon. West wind around 12 mph.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.shortForecast: Mostly Cloudy then Chance Light Rain
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain after 4am. Mostly cloudy. Low around 49, with temperatures rising to around 51 overnight. Southwest wind 5 to 10 mph. Chance of precipitation is 30%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
The air holds a gentle coolness this afternoon in Downtown San Francisco, where the sun peeks through a delicate layer of clouds, casting a soft glow over the city. The visibility is fairly clear, though hints of fog cling to the edges of the bay, subtly softening the outlines of the Golden Gate Bridge and the distant hills. As temperatures coast lazily near the mid-sixties, the breeze from the west whispers through the streets at about 12 mph, adding an invigorating chill that balances the warmth of the day. 

As the evening approaches, the canopy of clouds thickens, promising a light drizzle after four, though it is wise to prepare with a steady heart, as the chance of rain remains modest at 30%. The mercury is set to dip to the upper forties, so layering up with a light jacket and a warm scarf will ensure comfort as you navigate the bustling streets. Tonight might beckon a quiet stroll along the waterfront, or perhaps a visit to a cozy café, where the soft chatter of conversation and clinking of cups can accompany your evening. Embrace the nuances of the day, allowing the interplay of light and shadow to weave through your urban experience.
